page.title: 03Well Dressing Queen 1985.
page.content: My dress had four lace tiers and it was made of cream satin.The boys in my retinue wore green velvet trousers,a frilly shirt and a green velvet waistcoat with gold painted buttons. At the church service the Vicar gave me a lovely inscribed Bible to mark the occasion.At the Well I was given a drink of water from a goblet.A local newspaper photographer took some pictures of the events.On the field we had the crowning ceremony then we watched the Maypole dancing.At the fair I went on the Scrambler and the Dodgem Cars.I also won a goldfish. On the Sunday we were invited to the Methodist Church where I was presented with a prayer book and we sang hymns.I enjoyed being the Queen but I was disappointed when it rained heavily on the Monday and many of the planned events had to be cancelled.
